<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tengu Feather Fan](/Feats.aspx?ID=2439) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Tengu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=240" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Ancestry Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=74) pg. 58 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The fan you gain from this feat is a held item (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 572)_

</column>

---

You've learned to bind some of your feathers together into a fan to focus your ancestral magic. You gain a _tengu feather fan_: a magic item of light Bulk with a level equal to your level and the [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65) and [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134) traits. You (and only you) can use the _tengu feather fan_ to cast tengu magic. If your fan is lost or destroyed, you can create a replacement during your daily preparations; if you do so, your previous fan falls apart into mundane feathers. Further feats might grant you additional activations of your _tengu feather fan_, but you can never have more than three activations per day, no matter how many such feats you have. The DC for spells you cast with your _tengu feather fan_ is your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

 You can cast the 1st-level [_gust of wind_](/Spells.aspx?ID=143) spell by activating your tengu feather fan.

<document level="2" id="action-705" />

<title level="2">Tengu Feather Fan leads to...</title>
[Wind God's Fan](/Feats.aspx?ID=2440)
